subject: [Lab 02] Q5: Make Adder
content:
Q5: Make Adder

Please post all questions you have below concerning Q5: Make Adder in the follow-ups.

If you are stuck on this question, feel free to read through the follow-up responses to see if you can draw any ideas from them.

threads.question: Why is k equal to 9 after add_ten(n) was executed?

follow-ups.feedback: Trace the environment diagram step-by-step (which is what the question asks for) and it should be revealed how `k` gets bound to a value

threads.question: Why is n not assigned in f2? Is it because the value lookup rules that if we can find the required value in its parent frame then no more assignment is needed?

follow-ups.feedback: Yes, also there's no assignment statement within f2.

threads.question: Why 9 is bound to k? Because add_ten is in global frame, so we should look for n in global frame first?![](/redirect/s3?bucket=uploads&prefix=attach%2Fjziyku5gomy7aq%2Fjzt20qlrozj7mg%2Fk0ioqmkayh0j%2F%E5%BE%AE%E4%BF%A1%E6%88%AA%E5%9B%BE_20190913152009.png)

follow-ups.feedback: the value of n is 9 in the global frame, so it is working as you described.
